channel.title: The Long View: Biohacking
channel.description: Solo, long-form reflections on biohacking: the state of the field in 2025, what actually works, and the ethics and limits of human optimization.
channel.itunes:author: Alex Morgan

item.title: Episode 1: Biohacking in 2025: From Fringe to Framework
item.description: A grounded overview of biohacking in 2025: why it moved from fringe experimentation toward measurement, fundamentals, and systems thinking—and where it still goes wrong.

item.title: Episode 2: Sleep, Metabolism, and Measurement: What Actually Works
item.description: A practical framework for 2025: how sleep and metabolism interact, what wearables and glucose data can (and cannot) tell you, and how to integrate measurement without obsession.

item.title: Episode 3: Ethics, Limits, and the Next Decade of Human Optimization
item.description: A sober look at what biohacking cannot solve: biological constraints, ethical trade-offs, inequality risks, and how the next decade may normalize—rather than sensationalize—human optimization.
